SEARCH
Package ca.openosp.openo.utility

Class LoggedInInfo

java.lang.Object
ca.openosp.openo.utility.LoggedInInfo
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public final class LoggedInInfo extends Object implements Serializable
The Provider fields should only be used if this is a user based thread, i.e. a thread handling a user request. If this is an internal system thread, those fields should be ignored and left null. The initiatingCode field can be used for both internal threads as well as user requests. It should signify where the code started for the most part, i.e. the thread class name, or the jsp name, or www service name and method.
See Also:

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object

    • getLoggedInInfoAsCurrentClassAndMethod

      public static LoggedInInfo getLoggedInInfoAsCurrentClassAndMethod()
      This method is intended to be used by timer task or background threads to setup the thread local loggedInInfo. It should do basic checks to see if there's lingering data, then set the thread local internalThreadDescription to the name of the class that called this method, i.e. your thread class name.

    • setLoggedInInfoIntoSession

      public static void setLoggedInInfoIntoSession(javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session, LoggedInInfo loggedInInfo)
      This method should be used for browser requests / end user requests.

    • getLoggedInInfoFromSession

      public static LoggedInInfo getLoggedInInfoFromSession(javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session)
      This method should be used for browser requests / end user requests.

    • getLoggedInInfoFromSession

      public static LoggedInInfo getLoggedInInfoFromSession(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      This method should be used for browser requests / end user requests. This will pick out the session from the request object. It doesn't attempt to get it from the requestAttributes.

    • setLoggedInInfoIntoRequest

      public static void setLoggedInInfoIntoRequest(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, LoggedInInfo loggedInInfo)
      This method should be used for www services. This will be stored in the requestAttributes, not the session.

    • getLoggedInInfoFromRequest

      public static LoggedInInfo getLoggedInInfoFromRequest(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      This method should be used for www services. This will be retrieved from the requestAttributes, not the session.

    • removeLoggedInInfoFromSession

      public static void removeLoggedInInfoFromSession(javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session)
      This is used for logout only, should not be used at the end of a request.
